Legal_Issue: Whether the Pensions Appeal Board correctly applied the legal test of 'an arguable case' and reasonably concluded ineligibility for CPP disability benefits
Application_Facts: Applicant suffered a thumb injury in 1999; worked regularly until 2004; delusional disorder diagnosed after minimum qualifying period (MQP) of December 31, 2001
Decision_Outcome: PAB's decision upheld; judicial review dismissed without costs
Remedy_Requested: Judicial review of PAB's denial of appeal rights
Defendant_Behavior: PAB denied appeal rights based on lack of arguable case
Grounds_for_Claim: Alleged severe and prolonged disability due to thumb injury and mental health condition
Legal_Standard: Severe and prolonged disability as of MQP; 'arguable case' test
Assessment_Factor: Nature and severity of injury, timing of disability onset, work activity post-injury
Review_Standard: Correctness of legal test; reasonableness of application
Evidence_Used: Medical records, employment history, post-MQP psychiatric diagnosis
Legal_Provision_Cited: Criteria for CPP disability pension eligibility
Application_Basis: Failure to meet severe and prolonged disability requirement by MQP
Evidence_Assessed: Thumb injury did not constitute severe and prolonged disability by December 31, 2001; post-MQP conditions irrelevant
Relief_Sought: Reversal of PAB's decision denying disability benefits
Governing_Rule: To qualify for CPP disability pension, claimant must prove severe and prolonged disability as of MQP
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Lack of evidence showing disability was severe and prolonged by MQP
Outcome: Applicant found ineligible for disability benefits
Cause_Description: Applicant challenged denial of disability benefits based on alleged inability to work due to injury and mental illness
Evidence_Handling: Post-MQP medical conditions excluded from assessment
Evidence_Issues: Temporal relevance of evidence: post-MQP diagnoses not admissible for eligibility determination
Legal_Provision: Canada Pension Plan - Disability Benefit Provisions
Evidence_Assessment: Evidence showed continued work until 2004, undermining claim of disability by MQP
Decision_Rationale: No arguable case established; correct legal test applied; decision reasonable
Evidentiary_Issues: Exclusion of post-MQP conditions from eligibility assessment
Legal_Standard_Applied: 'Arguable case' standard under CPP disability framework
